final_answer:
The humor in this image comes from a visual play on the phrase "Yes, but." 

On the left, the bed is neatly made, suggesting agreement or compliance with a typical expectation of tidiness, represented by the "Yes." On the right, the bed is messy, with the blanket tangled, which humorously contrasts the neatness expected, representing the "But."

The juxtaposition of the two beds with identical observers emphasizes the contrast. The tidy bed meets expectations, while the messy one humorously defies them, playing on the absurdity of doing the minimum to comply while still technically fulfilling the requirement of making the bed. It's a satirical look at how people can "technically" meet standards but in an unexpected or humorous way.
